thread.title: Francisco Porcella’s huge wave at Nazaré is even more terrifying in black and white
thread.title_full: Francisco Porcella’s huge wave at Nazaré is even more terrifying in black and white

author: Ryan Brower
title: Francisco Porcella’s huge wave at Nazaré is even more terrifying in black and white
text:
A post shared by Pedro Miranda (@plmiranda) on Feb 28, 2017 at 8:11am PST 
This wave is terrifying enough, and it’s probably going to net Porcella an award of some sort come time for the Big Wave Awards. But filmer Kylian Castells put it in a moody black and white, and it’s even more terrifying than previously thought. 
The other big story from Nazaré this week was the head injury suffered by Pedro “Scooby” Vianna . Scooby was a standout himself before the paddle sessions started on Wednesday when he ended up suffering the head injury. 
RELATED: Big-wave surfer Pedro ‘Scooby’ Vianna suffers head injury during Nazaré paddle session 
According to an Instagram post, Scooby is currently back at home in Brazil recovering after the head injury. Photographer Shannon Marie Quirk told GrindTV that he took two staples on the inside of his head and 15 stitches to the outside. A post shared by Pedro Scooby (@pedroscooby) on Mar 1, 2017 at 3:00pm PST 
Hopefully Scooby heals up quick and can be back out there the next time Nazaré puts on its best face again.
